choices.A: Changing the time zone on the ESXi host.
choices.B: Re-installing the NSX VIBs on the ESXi host.
choices.D: Reconfiguring the ESXi host with a local NTP server.
choices.C: Restarting the NTPservice on the ESXi host.

discussion.content:
Answer - C "reload the edge node or restart the data plane for time-based gateway firewall policy to take effect"
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/administration/GUID-8572496E-A60E-48C3-A016-4A081AC80BE7.html

Selected Answer: C
from [NSX:Troubleshooting and Operation]Course Guide.
Module 7: Troubleshooting Security

I believe C is the correct answer, the process restart in theory will reconfigure the firewall if needed

questions.question_text: Which troubleshooting step will resolve an error with code 1001 during the configuration of a time-based firewall rule?
Which VMware GUI tool is used to identify problems in a physical network?
When collecting support bundles through NSX Manager, which files should be excluded for potentially containing sensitive information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Audit Files does not exists, the correct name is "Audit logs".
Once there is only one correct answer here, must be B, Core Files
Core files and audit logs might contain sensitive information such as passwords or encryption keys.

comments.content: yes, the catch is audit logs not audit files, so answer should be core files

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The collected core files contain system information and all information stored in memory at the time of the system dump. These files might include confidential, sensitive, or personal information, such as passwords or encryption keys that were being processed in memory at that time.

Selected Answer: A
Sam like others... two answers here but one choice...seriously Vmware....

We have 2 answers...

Core files and Audit logs might contain sensitive information such as passwords or encryption keys.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/administration/GUID-73D9AF0D-4000-4EF2-AC66-6572AD1A0B30.html
must be Core Files, letter B
